About Fresh Clean Threads Crew Neck T-Shirts

The Fresh Clean Threads Crew Neck T-shirts are made of 60% cotton and 40% polyester, which makes them lightweight and soft to the touch. When it comes to fit, Fresh Clean Threads doesn’t disappoint. The shirts aren’t tight around the arms and aren’t too baggy, either. They have nice color options but don’t offer graphic, printed, and patterned tees. Another thing to think about is that the fabric runs a bit thin.

The Fresh Clean Threads Crew Neck T-shirts are great for guys who love to keep their casual outfits neat and simple but still want to stand out a bit. The shirt’s fit allows you to show off your muscular and athletic build, and bulkier guys will look slimmer. These don’t need a break-in period because they’ll look and feel great out of the box as long as you order sizes closest to your measurements.

If you do end up ordering a tighter fit, then just wear them a couple of times, and they’ll eventually stretch to your shape. Since Fresh Clean tees are mostly solid in color, they’re perfect as undershirts or spring and summer attire. Pair them with your denim pants or chinos, and you’ll look outstanding wherever you go.

As previously mentioned, these shirts might be too thin for some guys. Wearing the white T-shirt, I can peek parts of my body through it, especially if I’m directly under a light source. If you have white tees as your staples and wear them without layers often, you’re better off looking for brands with thicker fabric instead.

Fresh Clean Threads aren’t consistent with their construction, either. Some of the shirts I ordered have thicker fabric than others and have longer lengths around the sleeves and waist. Despite what the brand claims, these shirts are soft but more midweight, so don’t expect them to be completely breezy when worn.

How To Care For Fresh Clean Tees

Caring for your Fresh Clean T-shirts isn’t that hard. Just machine wash them in cold water and tumble dry them on low. There might be a chance that they’ll shrink a quarter inch in size after the first few attempts, but if you want to avoid that, just employ line drying.

In case the garments tend to shrink more than that, you can reach out to the brand and see if you’re eligible for replacement. It’s also important not to wear these shirts as activewear. I can’t stress enough how thin the fabric is, but if you’re planning to play sports with them on, they might easily get damaged.
